reviewText: They should send copies of this DVD to the residents of CA where they have the dirtiest beaches with trash, sewer, chemicals, cigarette butts among all type of debris that gets dumped into the Pacific Ocean while those arrogant movie stars continuously act as the defenders of environments and planet earth when all they care about is their image and have nothing to show when it comes to protecting the environment except making themselves part of the talk just to get recognition for a better box office. The most amazing episode of the series in Saving the Ocean: Season 1 are those Muslims, African Muslims of Zanzibar Archipelago, North of Madagascar, off the East African coast, where local villagers fought a resort development in their pristine reefs and lagoons through a combination of activism, education, and regulation and in this case Islam religion. Now these are poor fishermen with hardly any resources other than the ocean and how they unite to bring peace with what they have meanwhile saving their environment is an accomplishment that no Western society with all their technologies and preaching has been able to accomplish much especially when it comes to saving planet earth and respecting not only their citizens but the creatures that surrounds them. Amazing how nature can help humans in so many ways if only humans understood that they are only a small part of the whole equation. Don't tell that to those Californians who continuously act as the champions of immigration, environment and equality where their achievements is nothing but disgrace in comparison to those in Zanzibar Archipelago. Only if one could get it through the heads of those careless Californians. Amazing.
